All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AdamOptimizer
An Optimizer which updates parameters according to the vanilla optimization step: theta_i = theta_i - lr * theta.grad If enabled, this Optimizer will clip gradients to be within a specified range (to encourage numerical stability).

Dense
A class that represents a Dense connection between two groups of artificial neurons (i.e.
DistanceMetric
 
ElementWiseOperator
A base class for an arbitrary element-wise function that can be applied to a Matrix
Flatten
A Module that represents the Identity activation Function f(x) = x.
Functions
A class to contain a small library of useful element-wise operators such as exponentiation, tanh, etc.
Functions.ExpElementWiseOperator
A child class of ElementWiseOperator, this class represents exponentiation to each element of a Matrix
Functions.TanhElementWiseOperator
A child class of ElementWiseOperator, this class represents tanh to each element of a Matrix
Game
 
GameTest
 
GradTest
 
Identity
A Module that represents the Identity activation Function f(x) = x.
LossFunction
The base class for a loss function
Matrix
The Matrix class which stores elements in a dense format.
Matrix.Selector
 
MatrixTester
 
MeanSquaredError
A LossFunction that represents Mean Squared Error = (1/(2*N)) * sum(i=1 to N) (||y_hat_i - y_gt_i||_2^2)
Model
The base class of a Model (i.e.
Module
A base class for a Module in the block diagram of a neural network.
Optimizer
An abstract class for updating the Parameters of a neural network.
Pair<K,V>
 
Parameter
A class that contains a Parameter Matrix in a Neural Network.
ReLU
A Module that represents the ReLU activation Function f(x) = max(x, 0).
Sequential
A Model that represents a neural network where layers are arranged sequentially (i.e.
SGDOptimizer
An Optimizer which updates parameters according to the vanilla optimization step: theta_i = theta_i - lr * theta.grad If enabled, this Optimizer will clip gradients to be within a specified range (to encourage numerical stability).
Shape
A class to contain the pair (numRows, numCols) for a 2d matrix object (which can also be vectors) In the future I might expand this to allow for arbitrary dimensional matrices, but 2d for now
Sigmoid
A Module that represents the Sigmoid activation Function f(c,x) = c/(1 + e^(-x)).
Tanh
A Module that represents the Sigmoid activation Function f(c,x) = c*tanh(x).
Triple<K,V,T>
